Name: 3Sum
Interview Signal: Pointer movement + duplicate handling under pressure
Pattern Notes: Fixed element + two pointers. Handle duplicates carefully.

Name: 4Sum II (Hash Map)
Pattern Notes: Divide into 2 pairs. Hash map for sum of 2 arrays, lookup -(sum) in other 2.

Name: Add Two Numbers
Pattern Notes: Carry propagation. Handle different lengths!

Name: Advantage Shuffle (Greedy Match)
Pattern Notes: Sort both arrays. Match smallest with smallest if possible, else use weakest.

Name: Alien Dictionary
Pattern Notes: Build graph from word order. Topological sort!

Name: Array Nesting
Pattern Notes: Find longest cycle. Mark visited in-place by negation. Each element visited once.

Name: Best Time to Buy and Sell Stock
Pattern Notes: Track minimum and maximum profit. Classic Kadane's variant.

Name: Best Time to Buy and Sell Stock II
Pattern Notes: Greedy: add all positive differences. Collect all upward trends.

Name: Best Time to Buy and Sell Stock with Cooldown
Pattern Notes: 🆕 State Machine DP: 3 states (hold, sold, rest). Transitions: rest→hold (buy), hold→sold (sell), sold→rest (cooldown), rest→rest (wait). Track max profit for each state. Related: Best Time to Buy/Sell Stock II, IV, with Transaction Fee

Name: Best Time to Buy and Sell Stock with Transaction Fee (State Machine)
Pattern Notes: State Machine: 2 states (hold, no_stock). hold[i] = max(hold[i-1], no_stock[i-1] - prices[i]). no_stock[i] = max(no_stock[i-1], hold[i-1] + prices[i] - fee). Related: Best Time to Buy/Sell Stock with Cooldown, II, IV

Name: Binary Tree Right Side View
Pattern Notes: BFS level order. Take last of each level!

Name: Candy Distribution
Pattern Notes: Two-pass greedy. Left-to-right for increasing, right-to-left for decreasing. Take max.

Name: Car Pooling (Sweep Line)
Pattern Notes: Difference array / sweep line for event-based range updates.

Name: Coin Change II
Pattern Notes: Count ways. Unbounded knapsack variant.

Name: Combination Sum II
Pattern Notes: Each element used once. Sort + skip duplicates. Combines Subsets II + Combo Sum!

Name: Construct Binary Tree from Preorder and Inorder
Pattern Notes: Preorder root + inorder split. Use hashmap!

Name: Continuous Subarray Sum (Modulo)
Pattern Notes: Prefix sum modulo pattern. Use hash map to store remainders. Critical for modulo-based range queries. Related: Subarray Sum Equals K, Subarray Sums Divisible by K

Name: Copy List with Random Pointer
Pattern Notes: HashMap or interleaving. Deep copy!

Name: Count Good Nodes in Binary Tree
Pattern Notes: Track max from root. Count if >= max!

Name: Count Number of Nice Subarrays
Pattern Notes: 🆕 Counting Technique: Convert to binary (odd=1, even=0), then 'exactly k' = 'at most k' - 'at most k-1'. Use sliding window to count at most k ones. Related: Subarrays with K Different Integers, Binary Subarrays with Sum

Name: Count of Smaller After Self
Pattern Notes: Count inversions with merge sort or BIT/Fenwick tree. Track indices during merge.

Name: Counting Bits
Pattern Notes: DP: dp[i] = dp[i >> 1] + (i & 1). Or dp[i] = dp[i & (i-1)] + 1. Tests bit DP!

Name: Course Schedule II
Pattern Notes: Same as I but return order. Kahn's algorithm or DFS with stack.

Name: Design Add and Search Words
Pattern Notes: Trie + DFS for wildcard '.' matching. Tests Trie with backtracking! Meta loves this.

Name: Diameter of Binary Tree
Pattern Notes: Max path through any node = left_height + right_height. Track global max.

Name: Evaluate Reverse Polish Notation
Pattern Notes: Stack for operands. Pop two for operator, push result. Tests stack operations!

Name: Find All Anagrams in a String
Pattern Notes: Fixed-size sliding window. Compare frequency maps. Amazon loves this pattern!

Name: Find All Duplicates in Array
Pattern Notes: Sign flip pattern. nums[abs(nums[i])-1] *= -1. If already negative, it's duplicate.

Name: Find All Numbers Disappeared in Array
Pattern Notes: In-place marking using sign flip or index positioning.

Name: Find Minimum in Rotated Sorted Array
Pattern Notes: Binary search for pivot point!

Name: Find Right Interval
Pattern Notes: BS on intervals. For each interval's end, find smallest start >= end. Sort intervals, use BS.

Name: Find Smallest Divisor Given Threshold
Pattern Notes: Binary search on divisor [1, max(nums)]. For each mid, calculate sum of ⌈nums[i]/mid⌉. If sum ≤ threshold, try smaller divisor. Related: Koko Eating Bananas, Minimize Max Distance

Name: First Missing Positive
Pattern Notes: Cyclic Sort variant: Place nums[i] at index nums[i]-1 if in range [1,n]. After sorting, first index where nums[i] != i+1 is answer. O(1) space! Related: Missing Number, Find All Duplicates, Find Duplicate

Name: Flatten Binary Tree to Linked List
Pattern Notes: Reverse postorder: right, left, root. Connect in reverse. Or Morris traversal for O(1) space!

Name: Gas Station (Circular)
Pattern Notes: Greedy circular traversal. If total gas >= total cost, solution exists. Reset start when tank < 0.

Name: Generate Parentheses
Pattern Notes: Backtracking with constraints: open < n, close < open. Classic backtracking problem!

Name: Global and Local Inversions
Pattern Notes: Check if max(arr[0..i-2]) > arr[i]. If yes, has non-local inversion.

Name: Graph Valid Tree
Pattern Notes: Check: n-1 edges, no cycles, connected. Use Union-Find or DFS. Foundation for tree properties!

Name: H-Index II
Pattern Notes: BS application on sorted citations. Check if citations[mid] >= n-mid. Simple BS optimization of H-Index I.

Name: House Robber II
Pattern Notes: Circular array. Two passes: exclude first or last.

Name: Insert Interval
Pattern Notes: Add non-overlapping before, merge overlapping, add remaining. No sort needed!

Name: Interleaving String
Pattern Notes: 2D DP on strings. dp[i][j] = can form s3[0...i+j-1] from s1[0...i-1] and s2[0...j-1].

Name: Jump Game II (Minimum Jumps)
Pattern Notes: BFS/Greedy. Track current window end and furthest. Increment jumps at window end.

Name: Jump Game III (Find Zero)
Pattern Notes: BFS/DFS with visited tracking. Bidirectional jumps (i+arr[i], i-arr[i]).

Name: Kth Largest Element in Array
Pattern Notes: QuickSelect O(n) avg or Heap O(n log k).

Name: Kth Largest Element in Stream
Pattern Notes: Min heap of size k. Top is kth largest. Foundation for heap problems!

Name: Kth Smallest Element in BST
Pattern Notes: Inorder traversal. Count k elements!

Name: Letter Combinations of Phone Number
Pattern Notes: Backtracking with mapping. Generate all combinations!

Name: Linked List Cycle II
Pattern Notes: Floyd's + math. Find cycle start!

Name: Longest Increasing Subsequence
Pattern Notes: O(n²) DP or O(n log n) with binary search!

Name: Longest Palindromic Substring - Manacher's
Pattern Notes: Manacher's algorithm - O(n) palindrome detection. Advanced but important. Use expanding centers as backup.

Name: Longest Substring with At Most K Distinct Characters
Pattern Notes: Sliding window + hash map. Expand while distinct <= k, shrink when > k. Fundamental sliding window.

Name: Magnetic Force Between Two Balls
Pattern Notes: Same pattern as Aggressive Cows. BSOA on minimum force (distance). Greedy: place balls greedily with min distance, check if all placed.

Name: Majority Element (Boyer-Moore)
Pattern Notes: Boyer-Moore Voting Algorithm. Foundation for n/2 and n/3 variants.

Name: Majority Element II (n/3)
Pattern Notes: Extended Boyer-Moore for n/3. At most 2 candidates possible.

Name: Maximum Points You Can Obtain from Cards
Pattern Notes: Reverse thinking: pick k from ends = find MINIMUM subarray of size (n-k) in middle. Use fixed sliding window to find min sum, answer = total - min_sum. Related: Subarray Sum Equals K, Maximum Subarray

Name: Maximum Product Subarray
Pattern Notes: Note: This IS in Striver Arrays but marking here as it's also a DP problem. Track both max and min (negatives flip).

Name: Maximum Subarray (Kadane's Algorithm)
Pattern Notes: Pure Kadane's. Must know both versions: max subarray sum and indices.

Name: Maximum Sum Circular Subarray
Pattern Notes: Two cases: max subarray or total - min subarray. Handle all negative case.

Name: Min Stack
Pattern Notes: Two stacks: main + min. Or store (value, current_min) pairs. Design problem!

Name: Minimize Max Distance to Gas Station
Pattern Notes: Fractional binary search! Search on real numbers with precision. Binary search on max distance, check if K stations enough. Google asks this often.

Name: Minimum Cost to Merge Stones
Pattern Notes: Interval DP variant. Merge K piles at a time. 3D DP: dp[i][j][p] = min cost to merge [i,j] into p piles.

Name: Minimum Height Trees
Pattern Notes: Trim leaves level by level until 1-2 nodes remain. Find graph center. Unique BFS pattern!

Name: Minimum Number of Days to Make m Bouquets
Pattern Notes: Binary search on days [min(bloomDay), max(bloomDay)]. For each day, count consecutive k-flower groups. If groups ≥ m, try fewer days. Related: Koko Eating Bananas, Capacity to Ship Packages

Name: Minimum Time to Complete Trips
Pattern Notes: Binary search on time [1, min(time)*totalTrips]. For each mid, calculate total trips = Σ(mid/time[i]). If ≥ totalTrips, try less time. Related: Koko Eating Bananas, Capacity to Ship Packages

Name: Missing Number
Pattern Notes: XOR or sum formula. Simple!

Name: Next Greater Element II (Circular)
Pattern Notes: Circular array with monotonic stack. Process array twice or use modulo.

Name: Number of 1 Bits
Pattern Notes: n & (n-1) removes rightmost 1!

Name: Pacific Atlantic Water Flow
Pattern Notes: DFS from both oceans. Find intersection!

Name: Palindrome Linked List
Pattern Notes: Find middle, reverse second half, compare. O(1) space solution!

Name: Palindrome Partitioning
Pattern Notes: Backtracking + DP for palindrome check. Generate all valid partitions. Amazon favorite!

Name: Partition Equal Subset Sum
Pattern Notes: Foundation 0/1 knapsack variant. Check if subset with sum=total/2 exists. Critical pattern for understanding knapsack!

Name: Pascal's Triangle
Pattern Notes: Build row by row. row[j] = prev[j-1] + prev[j]. Foundation for nCr problems.

Name: Pascal's Triangle II (Get Row)
Pattern Notes: Space optimized. Update row in reverse. O(k) space for kth row.

Name: Perfect Squares
Pattern Notes: Unbounded knapsack variant. Find minimum squares that sum to n. Also solvable with BFS!

Name: Permutations II
Pattern Notes: Sort + skip same elements at same level. Dedup pattern!

Name: Predict the Winner
Pattern Notes: Minimax with DP. dp[i][j] = max diff for subarray [i,j].

Name: Product of Array Except Self
Pattern Notes: Left products + right products. O(1) space trick!

Name: Range Addition (Difference Array)
Pattern Notes: Difference array pattern for multiple range updates. arr[l] += val, arr[r+1] -= val. Related: Corporate Flight Bookings, Car Pooling

Name: Range Sum Query - Immutable
Pattern Notes: Classic prefix sum array. Foundation for range query optimization.

Name: Redundant Connection
Pattern Notes: Union-Find to detect cycle edge. Find edge that creates cycle. Tests cycle detection!

Name: Remove Duplicates from Sorted Array II
Pattern Notes: Two pointers. Allow up to k duplicates. Check nums[i] != nums[slow-k].

Name: Remove Nth Node From End
Pattern Notes: Two pointers with n gap. One pass solution!

Name: Reorder List
Pattern Notes: Find middle, reverse second half, merge!

Name: Repeated DNA Sequences
Pattern Notes: Sliding window + HashSet. Track 10-char substrings. Also solvable with Rabin-Karp!

Name: Reverse Bits
Pattern Notes: Shift and build. Bit by bit!

Name: Reverse Nodes in k-Group
Pattern Notes: Reverse in chunks of k. Check if k nodes remain. Advanced reversal pattern!

Name: Rotate Array
Pattern Notes: Three reversal trick. O(1) space solution essential.

Name: Rotate Image
Pattern Notes: Transpose + reverse rows. Or layer-by-layer rotation.

Name: Search a 2D Matrix
Pattern Notes: Treat as 1D array. Binary search!

Name: Serialize and Deserialize Binary Tree
Pattern Notes: BFS or preorder with null markers. Reconstruct using queue. Very common in system design!

Name: Set Matrix Zeroes
Pattern Notes: Use first row/col as markers. O(1) space trick!

Name: Shortest Common Supersequence
Pattern Notes: LCS application. SCS length = len(s1) + len(s2) - LCS. Then reconstruct the string.

Name: Single Number (XOR)
Pattern Notes: XOR properties: a^a=0, a^0=a. Foundation for XOR patterns.

Name: Single Number II (Threes)
Pattern Notes: Count bits mod 3. Advanced bit manipulation pattern.

Name: Sort Colors (Dutch National Flag)
Pattern Notes: Three-way partitioning. low, mid, high pointers pattern.

Name: Spiral Matrix
Pattern Notes: Layer-by-layer traversal with four boundaries. Edge case handling.

Name: Split Array with Same Average
Pattern Notes: BSOA + DP combo. Complex problem combining multiple techniques. Google favorite.

Name: Stone Game (Optimal Strategy)
Pattern Notes: Game theory DP. Player maximizes difference. First player always wins for even n.

Name: Student Attendance Record II
Pattern Notes: State machine DP! Track (absences, consecutive lates). Similar to stock cooldown pattern!

Name: Subsets II
Pattern Notes: Sort + skip duplicates. Same pattern as Subsets with dedup!

Name: Subtree of Another Tree
Pattern Notes: Check if same tree at each node.

Name: Sum of Two Integers
Pattern Notes: XOR for sum without carry, AND << 1 for carry. Repeat until no carry. Bit arithmetic!

Name: Surrounded Regions
Pattern Notes: DFS from borders. Mark safe O's first!

Name: Target Sum
Pattern Notes: 0/1 knapsack variant. Convert to: count subsets with sum = (target + total) / 2. Very common!

Name: Time Based Key-Value Store
Pattern Notes: Design problem with BS. Store values with timestamps, BS to find largest timestamp <= query. System design flavor.

Name: Validate Binary Search Tree
Pattern Notes: Pass min/max bounds recursively. Or inorder traversal should be sorted. Classic!

Name: Walls and Gates
Pattern Notes: Multi-source BFS from gates. Similar to rotting oranges!

Name: Wiggle Sort
Pattern Notes: Swap adjacent elements if order wrong. nums[i] <= nums[i+1] >= nums[i+2].

Name: Wiggle Sort II
Pattern Notes: Find median, three-way partition, interleave. Virtual indexing trick: (1 + 2*i) % (n|1).

Name: Word Search II
Pattern Notes: Trie + DFS on grid. Optimize with pruning!

Name: Shortest Path Visiting All Nodes
Pattern Notes: State = (node, mask). Canonical bitmask DP.

Name: Split Array Into Consecutive Subsequences
Pattern Notes: Greedy with frequency + tails. Proof-heavy.

Name: Employee Free Time
Pattern Notes: Merge K sorted interval lists using min-heap (by start). Track current merged end; whenever next.start > curEnd, that gap is free time. Multi-list interval synthesis.

Name: Accounts Merge
Pattern Notes: Map each email -> id. Union emails belonging to same account. Finally group by DSU parent and sort emails. Tests DSU + hashing + grouping.

Name: Maximum Frequency Stack
Pattern Notes: Maintain freq map and group stacks: freq->stack of values. Track maxFreq. push: increment freq, push to that stack. pop: pop from maxFreq stack; decrement freq; drop maxFreq if empty.

Name: Minimum Cost to Make at Least One Valid Path in a Grid
Pattern Notes: Edges have cost 0 if you follow the cell’s arrow, else cost 1 to change direction. Use 0-1 BFS (deque) to find min cost from (0,0) to (m-1,n-1).

Name: Reorganize String
Pattern Notes: Max-heap by remaining count. Pop top two, append alternately, decrement counts, push back if remaining. If max count > (n+1)/2 impossible. Scheduling-with-constraints archetype.

Name: Partition Labels
Pattern Notes: Compute last index of each char. Sweep i, maintain current segment end = max(last[s[i]]). When i==end, cut partition. Greedy proof required.

Name: Find K Pairs with Smallest Sums
Pattern Notes: If arrays sorted: push pairs (i,0) for i in [0..min(k,n1)). Pop smallest sum, push neighbor (i,j+1). This is k-way merge on pair grid; avoid O(n1*n2).

Name: Minimum Cost to Connect Sticks
Pattern Notes: Always merge two smallest sticks first (min-heap). Total cost accumulates like Huffman coding optimal merge pattern.

Name: Time Needed to Inform All Employees
Pattern Notes: Build adjacency list from manager[] then DFS/BFS accumulate time along paths; answer = max root-to-leaf time. Common org-tree propagation model.

Name: Largest Divisible Subset
Pattern Notes: Sort. dp[i]=max subset ending at i where nums[i]%nums[j]==0. Track parent for reconstruction. Pattern: LIS-style DP + parent pointers.

Name: Minimum Number of Taps to Open to Water a Garden
Pattern Notes: Convert each tap to interval [i-r, i+r]. Build farthest reach per left boundary then run greedy like Jump Game II to count minimum segments to cover [0..n]. Strong reduction problem.

Name: Binary Indexed Tree (Fenwick) - Range Sum Query Mutable
Pattern Notes: Core BIT template. Point update + prefix sum. Use to solve inversion count, frequency prefix queries.

Name: Count of Smaller Numbers After Self (Fenwick variant)
Pattern Notes: You already have this—ensure you can solve with BIT + compression (not only mergesort).

Name: Number of Connected Components in an Undirected Graph
Pattern Notes: Classic DSU application. Build DSU, union edges, count unique parents.

Name: Evaluate Division
Pattern Notes: Graph BFS/DFS or DSU with weights. Common in real interviews.

Name: Find the Duplicate Number
Pattern Notes: Floyd’s cycle detection on array-as-linked-list. Very common trick question.

Name: Minimum Deletions to Make Character Frequencies Unique
Pattern Notes: Frequency counts + greedy using set/heap to reduce collisions. Practical pattern.

Name: Top K Frequent Words
Pattern Notes: Heap with custom comparator; common backend-style question.

Name: Kth Smallest Element in a Sorted Matrix
Pattern Notes: Two approaches: heap merge or BSOA on value range. Good synthesis.

Name: Longest Duplicate Substring
Pattern Notes: Rolling hash + BSOA. If too heavy, at least learn rolling-hash collision handling conceptually.

Name: Find All Duplicates in a String - (Repeated Substring / Rabin-Karp style)
Pattern Notes: If you skip longest-duplicate-substring, add at least one Rabin-Karp rolling hash implementation practice.

Name: Plates Between Candles
Pattern Notes: Uses prefix sums to handle plate count between candles. Demonstrates range sum queries and difference arrays for contiguous segments.

Name: Falling Squares
Pattern Notes: Uses line sweep with segment tree to track intervals heights after squares fall. Shows complex interval handling.

Name: Linked List Random Node
Pattern Notes: Applies reservoir sampling to pick a node from a stream-like linked list uniformly at random.

Name: Implement Rand10() Using Rand7()
Pattern Notes: Uses rejection sampling to generate a uniform random number from 1 to 10 using rand7.

Name: Erect the Fence
Pattern Notes: Computes the convex hull of a set of points using Graham scan or Jarvis march.

Name: Range Frequency Queries
Pattern Notes: Uses sqrt decomposition or block frequency counting to answer frequency of element in a range.

Name: Shuffle an Array
Pattern Notes: Use Fisher–Yates algorithm to shuffle the array uniformly in place.

Name: Unique Email Addresses
Pattern Notes: Normalize emails by handling plus signs and dots, then use a set to count unique addresses.

Name: Unique Number of Occurrences
Pattern Notes: Count occurrences of elements and ensure all frequencies are unique using a set.

Name: My Calendar I
Pattern Notes: Use an ordered set or balanced BST to store booked intervals and check for overlap on each insertion.

Name: Redundant Connection II
Pattern Notes: Detect and remove an extra directed edge in order to form a rooted tree. Combines indegree tracking and union find.

Name: Sliding Window Maximum
Pattern Notes: Maintain a deque of decreasing values to track the maximum in each sliding window.

Name: Most Stones Removed with Same Row or Column
Pattern Notes: Model stones sharing rows or columns as connected components; number of removable stones is total minus number of components.

Name: Find ages of daughters
Pattern Notes: Determine the ages of daughters based on clues.

Name: Monty Hall problem
Pattern Notes: Classic Monty Hall probability puzzle involving switching doors.

Name: 6×6 Grid - Ways to Reach Bottom Right
Pattern Notes: Count the number of ways to reach the bottom right of a 6×6 grid.

Name: Calculate total distance traveled by bee
Pattern Notes: Compute the distance traveled by a bee flying between two moving trains.

Name: 2 Eggs and 100 Floors
Pattern Notes: Determine the minimum number of attempts needed to find the critical floor using two eggs.

Name: Maximize the probability of White Ball
Pattern Notes: Arrange balls between boxes to maximize the probability of selecting a white ball.

Name: Hourglasses Puzzle
Pattern Notes: Measure a specific time using hourglasses of different durations.

Name: Poison and Rat
Pattern Notes: Identify the poisoned bottle using a limited number of test rats and time.

Name: 3 Bulbs and 3 Switches
Pattern Notes: Determine which switch corresponds to which bulb using limited visits.

Name: Water Jug Problem
Pattern Notes: Measure a desired quantity of water using jugs of different capacities.

Name: Blind man and Pills
Pattern Notes: Ensure correct dosage by choosing pills blindly without waste.

Name: 5 Pirates and 100 Gold Coins
Pattern Notes: Divide gold coins among pirates using voting strategy.

Name: 100 Prisoners with Red/Black Hats
Pattern Notes: Devise a strategy for prisoners to guess hat colors and maximize survival.

Name: Find the fastest 3 horses
Pattern Notes: Find the fastest three horses with minimal races and no timing equipment.

Name: 10 Coins Puzzle
Pattern Notes: Arrange coins according to a rule or to satisfy a condition.

Name: Tic Tac Toe Puzzle
Pattern Notes: Solve an arrangement or optimal play puzzle based on Tic Tac Toe.

Name: Days of the month using 2 dice
Pattern Notes: Arrange numbers on two dice to display all days of the month.

Name: Matchstick Puzzle
Pattern Notes: Rearrange matchsticks to form a particular shape or equation.

Name: 10 Balls in 5 Lines
Pattern Notes: Place 10 balls in 5 lines such that each line has 4 balls.

Name: Round table coin game
Pattern Notes: Arrange coins around a table following specific rules or conditions.

Name: 3 cuts to cut the round cake into 8 equal pieces
Pattern Notes: Cut a circular cake into 8 equal pieces with 3 cuts.

Name: Chessboard and dominos
Pattern Notes: Cover a chessboard with dominos under certain constraints.

Name: Splitting a Cake with a Missing Piece in two equal portions
Pattern Notes: Divide a cake with a missing piece into two equal portions.

Name: Maximum pieces that can be cut from a Circle using 6 straight lines
Pattern Notes: Determine the maximum number of pieces a circle can be cut into using six lines.

Name: 3 Ants and Triangle
Pattern Notes: Analyze ants walking on a triangle and the probability of collision.

Name: Subarray Sum Equals K
Purpose: Negative numbers variant breaks sliding window

Name: Maximum Subarray Sum With Length Divisible by K
Longest Continuous Subarray With Absolute Diff Less Than or Equal to Limit
Maximum Number of Robots Within Budget
Minimize the Maximum Difference of Pairs
Find Critical and Pseudo-Critical Edges in Minimum Spanning Tree
Optimize Water Distribution in a Village
Largest component size by common factor
Count of Smaller Numbers After Self
Two Sum
Pattern Notes: Hash Map pattern - complementary pairs. Foundation for many array problems.

Name: Trapping Rain Water
Pattern Notes: Two pointers from ends. Track max left/right. Water = min(maxL, maxR) - height.

Name: 4Sum
Pattern Notes: Two nested loops + two pointers. Handle duplicates carefully.

Name: Remove Duplicates from Sorted Array
Pattern Notes: Two pointers: slow (write) and fast (read). Classic in-place pattern.

Name: Container With Most Water
Pattern Notes: Two pointers from ends. Move shorter height. Classic greedy!

Name: Binary Search
Pattern Notes: Classic binary search. Foundation for all BS problems.

Name: Find Peak Element
Pattern Notes: Binary search: if nums[mid] < nums[mid+1], peak in right half.

Name: Find First and Last Position of Element in Sorted Array
Pattern Notes: Two BS: find first occurrence, then last. Classic boundary BS.

Name: Search in Rotated Sorted Array
Pattern Notes: Find sorted half. Binary search! Classic rotation problem.

Name: Koko Eating Bananas
Pattern Notes: Binary search on answer. Binary search on speed!

Name: Capacity to Ship Packages Within D Days
Pattern Notes: Binary search on ship capacity. For each mid, check if can ship in D days.

Name: Reverse Linked List
Pattern Notes: Foundation for all LL problems! Iterative and recursive solutions.

Name: Merge Two Sorted Lists
Pattern Notes: Iterative or recursive merge. Foundation!

Name: Linked List Cycle
Pattern Notes: Floyd's cycle detection (slow/fast pointers). Foundation!

Name: Intersection of Two Linked Lists
Pattern Notes: Two pointers: traverse both, switch at end. Or hash set.

Name: Remove Nth Node From End of List
Pattern Notes: Two pointers with n gap. One pass solution!

Name: Kth Largest Element in an Array
Pattern Notes: QuickSelect O(n) avg or Heap O(n log k).

Name: Top K Frequent Elements
Pattern Notes: Heap or bucket sort. O(n log k) vs O(n).

Name: Meeting Rooms II
Pattern Notes: Sort intervals by start. Use min-heap of end times.

Name: Find Median from Data Stream
Pattern Notes: Two heaps: max heap for lower, min heap for upper. Balance!

Name: Merge K Sorted Lists
Pattern Notes: Min heap with list heads. Or divide & conquer merge.

Name: Same Tree
Pattern Notes: Compare recursively. Check both structure and values.

Name: Maximum Depth of Binary Tree
Pattern Notes: Foundation tree DFS. max(left_depth, right_depth) + 1.

Name: Invert Binary Tree
Pattern Notes: Swap left and right recursively. Simple!

Name: Binary Tree Level Order Traversal
Pattern Notes: BFS with queue. Track level. Foundation!

Name: Path Sum
Pattern Notes: DFS with target sum. Subtract node value from target.

Name: Lowest Common Ancestor of Binary Tree
Pattern Notes: Return node if found p or q. LCA = node where both subtrees return non-null.

Name: Permutations
Pattern Notes: Swap elements or use visited array. Foundation!

Name: Subsets
Pattern Notes: Backtracking OR iterative. Foundation!

Name: Combination Sum
Pattern Notes: Backtracking with reuse allowed. Can pick same element multiple times!

Name: N-Queens
Pattern Notes: Backtracking with constraint checking!

Name: Word Search
Pattern Notes: DFS + backtracking on grid. Mark visited, restore after.

Name: Climbing Stairs
Pattern Notes: Fibonacci! dp[i] = dp[i-1] + dp[i-2].

Name: House Robber
Pattern Notes: dp[i] = max(dp[i-1], dp[i-2] + nums[i]). Classic 1D DP!

Name: Coin Change
Pattern Notes: Unbounded knapsack. dp[i] = min coins for amount i.

Name: Unique Paths
Pattern Notes: dp[i][j] = dp[i-1][j] + dp[i][j-1]. Grid DP foundation!

Name: Longest Common Subsequence
Pattern Notes: Classic 2D DP. LCS[i][j] = max lengths.

Name: Edit Distance
Pattern Notes: Levenshtein distance. Classic 2D DP. Insert/delete/replace operations.

Name: Longest Substring Without Repeating Characters
Pattern Notes: Sliding window with HashSet. Move left when duplicate!

Name: Minimum Window Substring
Pattern Notes: Sliding window with two pointers. Track char counts!

Name: Longest Repeating Character Replacement
Pattern Notes: Window size - max count <= k. Don't shrink max count!

Name: Subarray Product Less Than K
Pattern Notes: Sliding window with product. Count valid subarrays.

Name: Valid Parentheses
Pattern Notes: Stack for matching pairs. Most asked stack problem!

Name: Daily Temperatures
Pattern Notes: Monotonic stack. Find next greater element.

Name: Next Greater Element I
Pattern Notes: Monotonic decreasing stack. Foundation!

Name: Decode String
Pattern Notes: Stack for numbers and strings. When ], pop and repeat.

Name: Group Anagrams
Pattern Notes: Sorted string or char count as key.

Name: Longest Palindromic Substring
Pattern Notes: Expand from center. O(n²) or Manacher's O(n).

Name: Word Break
Pattern Notes: DP on strings. dp[i] = can segment s[0..i-1].

Name: Implement Trie (Prefix Tree)
Pattern Notes: TrieNode with children map + isEnd. Foundation!

Name: Jump Game
Pattern Notes: Track farthest reachable. If current > farthest, return false.

Name: Merge Intervals
Pattern Notes: Sort by start. Merge if overlapping. Very common!

Name: Non-overlapping Intervals
Pattern Notes: Sort by end time. Greedy: keep interval with earliest end.

Name: Number of Islands
Pattern Notes: DFS/BFS on grid. Mark visited. Count connected components.

Name: Course Schedule
Pattern Notes: Topological sort or cycle detection. Foundation!

Name: Clone Graph
Pattern Notes: DFS/BFS + HashMap for original->clone mapping. Meta loves this!

Name: Rotting Oranges
Pattern Notes: Multi-source BFS. Start from all rotten oranges!

Name: Word Ladder
Pattern Notes: BFS with word transformation. Build graph implicitly.

Name: Contains Duplicate
Pattern Notes: Hash set usage. Foundation for duplicate detection patterns.

Name: First Unique Character in a String
Pattern Notes: Count frequencies, find first with count 1.

Name: Intersection of Two Arrays
Pattern Notes: Use sets to compute intersection efficiently.

Name: Largest Rectangle in Histogram
Pattern Notes: Use NSL/NSR to compute width. Area = height * (right-left-1). Base for 2D extensions.

Name: Sum of Subarray Minimums
Pattern Notes: Each element contributes as min across its left/right span. Use modulo.

Name: Sliding Window Median
Pattern Notes: Two heaps + lazy deletion. Balance sizes to extract median.

Name: Range Sum Query 2D - Immutable
Pattern Notes: prefix[i+1][j+1] inclusion-exclusion. Query O(1).

Name: Number of Submatrices That Sum to Target
Pattern Notes: Fix rows

Name: Corporate Flight Bookings
Pattern Notes: Apply diff range updates then prefix to rebuild.

Name: Increment Submatrices by One
Pattern Notes: 2D diff array + prefix reconstruction.

Name: Longest Increasing Subsequence using BS
Pattern Notes: Patience sorting using tails array.

Name: Count Sub Islands
Pattern Notes: DFS and invalidate if grid2 cell not present in grid1.

Name: Basic Calculator
Pattern Notes: Stack for signs and parentheses. Evaluate expression inline.

Name: Shortest Bridge
Pattern Notes: DFS first island then BFS expansion.

Name: Implement strStr() - KMP Algorithm
Pattern Notes: Build LPS and scan text without backtracking.

Name: Count Primes
Pattern Notes: Mark multiples using Sieve of Eratosthenes.

Name: Min Cost to Connect All Points
Pattern Notes: Prim's on implicit complete graph.

Name: Kruskal's Algorithm
Pattern Notes: Sort edges and union via DSU.

Name: Sum of Distances in Tree
Pattern Notes: Postorder + reroot to compute all answers.

Name: Floyd Warshall Algorithm
Pattern Notes: DP over intermediate nodes.

Name: Regions Cut By Slashes
Pattern Notes: Split each cell into 4 and union accordingly.

Name: Largest Component Size by Common Factor
Pattern Notes: Union numbers by shared prime factors.

Name: Stream of Characters
Pattern Notes: Reverse trie queried per character.

Name: Inversion Count in Array using BIT
Pattern Notes: Coordinate compress + BIT queries.

Name: Skyline Problem
Pattern Notes: Process building edges with heap.

Name: Mo's Algorithm Introduction
Pattern Notes: Sort queries by block

Name: Random Flip Matrix
Pattern Notes: Map picked index to tail

Name: Burst Balloons
Pattern Notes: Choose last balloon in interval.

Name: New 21 Game
Pattern Notes: Sliding window probability DP.

Name: Can I Win
Pattern Notes: Bitmask DP with minimax.

Name: Convex Hull (Erect the Fence)
Pattern Notes: Graham scan using cross products.

Name: Regular Expression Matching
Pattern Notes: 2D DP: dp[i][j] = can s[0..i] match p[0..j]. Handle * and .

Name: Wildcard Matching
Pattern Notes: Similar to regex but simpler. Handle ? and *.

Name: Maximum XOR of Two Numbers in an Array
Pattern Notes: Bitwise Trie + greedy traversal. XOR maximization trick.

Name: Longest Consecutive Sequence
Pattern Notes: Hash set: find sequence starts, expand. Or DSU approach.

Name: Range Sum Query - Mutable
Pattern Notes: BIT or Segment Tree for point updates + range queries.

Name: Design HashMap
Pattern Notes: Implement hash map with chaining or open addressing.

Name: LRU Cache
Pattern Notes: HashMap + Doubly Linked List. O(1) get/put. Most asked design problem!

Name: Merge Sort
Pattern Notes: Classic divide & conquer. Split array, sort halves, merge. O(n log n) stable sort.

Name: Quick Sort
Pattern Notes: Partition around pivot, recursive sort. O(n log n) avg, O(n²) worst. Unstable.

Name: Heap Sort
Pattern Notes: Build max heap, extract max repeatedly. O(n log n) in-place unstable sort.

Name: Counting Sort
Pattern Notes: Count frequencies, rebuild array. O(n+k) for range [0,k]. Stable.

Name: Radix Sort
Pattern Notes: Sort by digits from least to most significant. O(d*(n+k)) for d digits.

Name: Find Greatest Common Divisor of Array
Pattern Notes: Euclidean algorithm: gcd(a,b) = gcd(b, a%b). Apply to array min/max.

Name: Nth Magical Number
Pattern Notes: LCM of a and b. Binary search on answer. Count magical numbers <= mid.

Name: Fast Modulo Power (Exponentiation)
Pattern Notes: Compute a^b mod m using binary exponentiation. O(log b) time.

Name: Greatest Common Divisor Traversal
Pattern Notes: Build graph where edges exist if gcd > 1. Check connectivity via DSU/BFS.

Name: Tower of Hanoi
Pattern Notes: Move n disks: move n-1 to aux, move largest to dest, move n-1 to dest. Classic recursion.

Name: Factorial of a Number
Pattern Notes: n! = n * (n-1)!. Base case: 0! = 1. Classic recursive definition.

Name: Fibonacci Number
Pattern Notes: F(n) = F(n-1) + F(n-2). Base: F(0)=0, F(1)=1. Classic recursion with memoization.

Name: Reverse a String using Recursion
Pattern Notes: Reverse(s) = last char + Reverse(s[1:-1]). Base: empty or single char.

Name: Check Palindrome using Recursion
Pattern Notes: Check first == last, recurse on middle. Base: empty or single char.

Name: Rectangle Overlap
Pattern Notes: Two rectangles overlap if not separated. Check x and y projections.

Name: Largest Triangle Area
Pattern Notes: Shoelace formula: area = 0.5 * |x1(y2-y3) + x2(y3-y1) + x3(y1-y2)|. Try all triplets.

Name: Valid Square
Pattern Notes: Check 4 equal sides and 2 equal diagonals. Use distance formula.

Name: Max Points on a Line
Pattern Notes: For each point, count points with same slope. Use gcd to normalize slope. Handle vertical lines.

Name: LFU Cache
Pattern Notes: HashMap + DLL buckets by frequency. Track minFreq. O(1) get/put. Advanced design.

Name: Design Twitter
Pattern Notes: HashMap + Heap for feeds. Merge k recent tweets. System design flavor.

Name: Design Search Autocomplete System
Pattern Notes: Trie + frequency tracking + heap for top K. System design pattern.

Name: Binary Search on Floating Point
Pattern Notes: BS on real numbers with precision. Check feasibility with epsilon tolerance.

Name: Flatten a Multilevel Doubly Linked List
Pattern Notes: DFS traversal, connect prev/next. Handle child pointers recursively.

Name: K Closest Points to Origin
Pattern Notes: Max heap of size k. Or QuickSelect. Use squared distance to avoid sqrt.

Name: Task Scheduler
Pattern Notes: Max heap + cooldown queue. Or math formula: (max_count-1)*n + count(max_count).

Name: House Robber III
Pattern Notes: DP on trees. Each node returns [include, exclude] states. Postorder traversal.

Name: Partition Array for Maximum Sum
Pattern Notes: dp[i] = max sum partitioning arr[0..i]. Try all partition points.

Name: 0-1 BFS
Pattern Notes: BFS with deque for 0/1 edge weights. O(V+E) instead of O(E log V).

Name: Reconstruct Itinerary
Pattern Notes: Hierholzer's algorithm. Eulerian path in directed graph. DFS with backtracking.

Name: Bellman Ford Algorithm
Pattern Notes: Relax edges V-1 times. Detects negative cycles. Handles negative weights.

Name: Strongly Connected Components
Pattern Notes: Tarjan's or Kosaraju's algorithm. Find all SCCs in directed graph.

Name: Move Zeroes
Pattern Notes: Two pointers: slow (non-zero) and fast. Move non-zeros to front.

Name: Squares of a Sorted Array
Pattern Notes: Two pointers from both ends, compare squares, fill from right.

Name: Remove Element
Pattern Notes: Two pointers: slow (write) and fast (read). Skip target element.

Name: Sort Colors
Pattern Notes: Three-way partitioning. low, mid, high pointers pattern.

Name: Merge Sorted Array
Pattern Notes: Two pointers from end. Fill from right to avoid overwriting.

Name: Search Insert Position
Pattern Notes: Binary search. Return left if not found. Classic boundary case.

Name: Sqrt(x)
Pattern Notes: Binary search on answer. Find largest integer whose square <= x.

Name: Valid Perfect Square
Pattern Notes: Binary search to check if number is perfect square.

Name: Find Smallest Letter Greater Than Target
Pattern Notes: Binary search with circular wrap. Find next greater letter.

Name: Single Element in a Sorted Array
Pattern Notes: BS: check if mid is in left/right pair. Pattern-based BS.

Name: Peak Index in a Mountain Array
Pattern Notes: Simpler version of Find Peak Element. Good BS warm-up.

Name: Add Two Numbers II
Pattern Notes: Reverse both lists, add, reverse result. Or use stack.

Name: Remove Duplicates from Sorted List
Pattern Notes: Traverse and skip duplicates. Simple pointer manipulation.

Name: Remove Linked List Elements
Pattern Notes: Remove all nodes with given value. Handle head removal.

Name: Odd Even Linked List
Pattern Notes: Group odd and even nodes. Two pointers approach.

Name: Middle of the Linked List
Pattern Notes: Fast/slow pointers. Fast moves 2x, slow moves 1x.

Name: Rotate List
Pattern Notes: Find length, connect tail to head, break at (length-k).

Name: Next Greater Element II
Pattern Notes: Circular array with monotonic stack. Process array twice.

Name: Online Stock Span
Pattern Notes: Monotonic stack. Count consecutive days with price <= today.

Name: Asteroid Collision
Pattern Notes: Stack to simulate collisions. Handle positive/negative asteroids.

Name: Remove K Digits
Pattern Notes: Monotonic stack. Remove larger digits greedily.

Name: Longest Valid Parentheses
Pattern Notes: Stack with indices or DP. Track longest valid substring.

Name: Last Stone Weight
Pattern Notes: Max heap. Pop two largest, smash, push difference.

Name: Seat Reservation Manager
Pattern Notes: Min heap for available seats. Design problem.

Name: Furthest Building You Can Reach
Pattern Notes: Min heap for ladder usage. Greedy: use ladder for largest gaps.

Name: Binary Tree Preorder Traversal
Pattern Notes: Root, left, right. Iterative with stack or recursive.

Name: Binary Tree Inorder Traversal
Pattern Notes: Left, root, right. Iterative with stack or recursive.

Name: Binary Tree Postorder Traversal
Pattern Notes: Left, right, root. Iterative with stack or recursive.

Name: Binary Tree Zigzag Level Order Traversal
Pattern Notes: BFS with level tracking. Reverse direction every level.

Name: Search in Binary Search Tree
Pattern Notes: BST property: go left if val < root, right if val > root.

Name: Insert into BST
Pattern Notes: Find insertion point using BST property. Insert as leaf.

Name: Delete a Node in BST
Pattern Notes: Three cases: no child, one child, two children. Replace with inorder successor.

Name: Lowest Common Ancestor of a Binary Search Tree
Pattern Notes: Use BST property. LCA is first node where paths diverge.

Name: Find if Path Exists in Graph
Pattern Notes: BFS/DFS to check if path exists from source to destination.

Name: Number of Provinces
Pattern Notes: DFS/BFS to count connected components. Or DSU.

Name: All Paths from Source to Target
Pattern Notes: DFS with backtracking. Find all paths from source to target.

Name: Keys and Rooms
Pattern Notes: BFS/DFS from room 0. Check if all rooms reachable.

Name: Min Cost Climbing Stairs
Pattern Notes: dp[i] = min(dp[i-1], dp[i-2]) + cost[i]. Start from index 0 or 1.

Name: Integer Break
Pattern Notes: dp[i] = max product breaking i. Try all splits.

Name: Decode Ways
Pattern Notes: dp[i] = ways to decode s[0..i]. Handle 1-digit and 2-digit cases.

Name: Jump Game I
Pattern Notes: dp[i] = can reach i. Or greedy: track farthest reachable.

Name: Reverse Words in a String
Pattern Notes: Reverse entire string, then reverse each word. Or split and reverse.

Name: String to Integer (atoi)
Pattern Notes: Parse integer with edge cases: whitespace, signs, overflow.

Name: Palindromic Substrings
Pattern Notes: Expand from center for each possible center. Count palindromes.

Name: Combination Sum III
Pattern Notes: Use digits 1-9, exactly k numbers, sum to n.

Name: Letter Case Permutation
Pattern Notes: Backtracking: change case of letters. Generate all permutations.

Name: Power of Two
Pattern Notes: n & (n-1) == 0 for power of 2. Or count bits.

Name: Convert a Number to Hexadecimal
Pattern Notes: Convert to hex using bit manipulation. Handle negative numbers.

Name: Happy Number
Pattern Notes: Floyd's cycle detection on digit squares. Math + cycle.

Name: Bulb Switcher
Pattern Notes: Only perfect squares remain on. Answer is sqrt(n).

Name: Design Parking System
Pattern Notes: Track available spots for each car type. Simple counter design.

Name: Design Circular Queue
Pattern Notes: Circular array implementation. Handle wrap-around.

Name: Design Browser History
Pattern Notes: Two stacks or DLL for back/forward. Common system design pattern.

Name: Design Underground System
Pattern Notes: Track check-ins and check-outs. Compute average time.
